'''Errol Spence Jr.''' (born March 3, 1990) is an American [[professional boxer]] who has held the [[International Boxing Federation|IBF]] [[welterweight]] title since 2017. As an [[amateur boxing|amateur]] he won three consecutive [[United States national amateur boxing championships|United States national championships]] and represented the U.S. at the [[2012 Olympics]], where he reached the quarter-finals; all in the welterweight division.
As of June 2018, Spence is ranked as the world's seventh best active boxer, [[pound for pound]], by ''[[The Ring magazine Pound for Pound|The Ring]]'' magazine;<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ringtv.com/ratings/|title=Ratings - The Ring|work=The Ring|access-date=2018-06-17|language=en-US}}</ref> he is also ranked as the world's best active welterweight by the [[Transnational Boxing Rankings Board]],<ref>[https://www.tbrb.org/all-rankings/ "Rankings"] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20141206020332/http://www.tbrb.org/all-rankings/ |date=2014-12-06 }}. [[Transnational Boxing Rankings Board]]. Retrieved June 17, 2018.</ref> and second by ''The Ring''<ref>[http://www.ringtv.com/ratings/?weightclass=279 "Ratings"]. ''[[The Ring (magazine)|The Ring]]''. June 17, 2018. Retrieved June 17, 2018.</ref> and [[BoxRec]].<ref>[http://boxrec.com/records "Boxer Ratings"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170104115343/http://boxrec.com/records |date=2017-01-04 }}. [[BoxRec]]. Retrieved June 17, 2018.</ref>
==Amateur career== In 2009, Spence won the U.S. National [[Golden Gloves]], and also won three consecutive [[United States national amateur boxing welterweight champions|national amateur welterweight championships]] from 2009 to 2011, all in the [[welterweight]] division.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110828084301/http://www.dallasnews.com/sports/more-sports/olympics/20110804-desoto_s-spence-can-make-u.s.-boxing-team-today.ece]</ref> Spence reached the quarter-finals at the [[2011 World Amateur Boxing Championships – Welterweight|2011 World Championships]], losing to [[Serik Sapiyev]].
On August 3, 2012 Errol won his fight against [[Vikas Krishan Yadav]] after the original result was overturned and made it to the quarterfinals of the [[Boxing at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's welterweight|London Olympic Games]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/sports/olympics-2012/aiba-overturns-errol-spence-loss-indian-welterweight-krishan-vikas-late-friday-night-article-1.1128873 |title=Olympics Insider: AIBA overturns Spence's loss |newspaper=[[New York Daily News]] |date=2012-08-04 |accessdate=2017-01-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://deadspin.com/5931821/another-ridiculous-olympic-boxing-decision-gets-reversed|title=Another Ridiculous Olympic Boxing Decision Gets Reversed|author=Tom Ley|work=Deadspin}}</ref>
Spence lost in the quarter finals of the 2012 London Olympics to Andrey Zamkovoy and turned professional shortly afterwards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/olympics/summer/2012/boxing/story/_/id/8245146/2012-summer-olympics-errol-spence-loss-ensures-no-us-boxing-medal |title=2012 Summer Olympics - Errol Spence's loss ensures no U.S. boxing medal |website=Espn.com |date=2012-08-08 |accessdate=2017-01-26}}</ref>
==Professional career== === Early career === On 9 November 2012, a 22 year old Spence made his professional debut at the [[Fantasy Springs Resort Casino|Fantasy Springs Casino]] in [[Indio, California|Indio]], [[California]] in a scheduled 4 round bout against 19 year old Jonathan Garcia. Spence knocked Garcia down and out in the 3rd round. In December 2012, Spence knocked out Richard Andrews at the [[Los Angeles Memorial Sports Arena|Sports Arena]] in [[Los Angeles]], California, which was part of undercard for [[Amir Khan (boxer)|Amir Khan]]'s comeback fight against Carlos Molina.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=https://www.boxing247.com/boxing-result/khan-vs-molina-early-undercard-results-santa-cruz-wins/6534/amp |title=Khan defeats Molina; Wilder, Angulo, Santa Cruz win |website=Boxing247.com |date=2012-12-15 |accessdate=2017-01-26}}</ref>
Spence fought eight times in 2013, being victorious in all of them, winning six inside the distance. He was taken the distance in an eight-round bout in October by Emmanuel Lartei Lartey. The fight was rather one-sided, with all judges scoring the fight 79-73 in favor of Spence.<ref>{{cite web|author=Jason Scavone |url=http://www.premierboxingchampions.com/news/errol-spence-jr-forgoes-knockout-goes-distance-his-greatest-hits |title=Errol Spence Jr. forgoes the knockout, goes the distance in his Greatest Hits |website=Premierboxingchampions.com |date=2015-04-08 |accessdate=2017-01-26}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://ringtv.craveonline.com/blog/178655-qaa-errol-spence-jr|title=Q&A: Errol Spence Jr.|author=Anson Wainwright|date=2 May 2013|work=Ring TV}}</ref> By the end of 2013, Spence had won all of his 10 professional fights, 8 of them by way of knockout.
Spence made his [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] television debut on 27 June 2014 at the Hard Rock Hotel in Las Vegas in a 10-round fight against Ronald Cruz. Spence was taken the distance and won a shutout unanimous decision.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.premierboxingchampions.com/news/errol-spence-jr-forgoes-knockout-goes-distance-his-greatest-hits|title=Errol Spence Jr. forgoes the knockout, goes the distance in his Greatest Hits|work=PBC Boxing|access-date=2017-06-05|language=en-US}}</ref>
On 13 December 2014, Spence beat Javier Castro by TKO in the 5th round at the MGM Grand Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.badlefthook.com/2014/12/13/7388639/khan-vs-alexander-results-jermell-charlo-victor-ortiz-errol-spence|title=Khan vs Alexander results: Jermell Charlo, Victor Ortiz, Errol Spence score wins|author=Scott Christ|date=14 December 2014|work=Bad Left Hook}}</ref>
=== Rising up the ranks === On 11 April 2015, Spence defeated [[Samuel Vargas]] by TKO in Round 4 of 10 in a ''[[Premier Boxing Champions]]'' fight card at [[Barclays Center]] in [[Brooklyn|Brooklyn, New York]], bringing his record to 16-0.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.premierboxingchampions.com/news/errol-spence-jr-brutally-outguns-samuel-vargas-en-route-tko-victory|title=Errol Spence Jr. brutally outguns Samuel Vargas en route to TKO victory|work=PBC Boxing}}</ref> On May 16, it was announced that Spence would feature on the undercard of [[Shawn Porter]] vs. [[Adrien Broner]] on June 20 at the [[MGM Grand Garden Arena|MGM Grand Arena]]. Spence defeated [[Phil Lo Greco]] (26-1, 14 KOs) via 3rd-round TKO.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/13108400/phil-lo-greco-approved-new-opponent-errol-spence-jr|title=Lo Greco approved as new opponent for Spence|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-10-06}}</ref> Spence was originally scheduled to fight [[Roberto García (Mexican boxer)|Roberto García]]. García backed out of the fight three days before the card due to weight issues.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/12895562/shawn-porter-adrien-broner-meet-june-20-welterweight-main-event|title=Welterweights Porter, Broner to meet June 20|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-10-03}}</ref> Spence landed 73 of 142 punched thrown (51%) and Lo Greco landed 19 of 132 (14%).<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/13122196/errol-spence-jr-demolishes-late-replacement-phil-lo-greco-three-rounds|title=Spence looks impressive in win|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-10-06}}</ref>
Spence next fought on the undercard of [[Adonis Stevenson|Stevenson]]-[[Tommy Karpency|Karpency]] against [[Chris van Heerden]] at the [[Ricoh Coliseum]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ringtv.com/398991-chris-van-heerden-looks-to-make-his-mark-tonight-against-errol-spence-jr/|title=Chris van Heerden looks to make his mark tonight against Errol Spence Jr. - The Ring|date=2015-09-11|work=The Ring|access-date=2017-10-07|language=en-US}}</ref> The referee stopped the fight in round 8, after Spence knocked down van Heerden twice in round 7 to win the [[International Boxing Federation|IBF]] International welterweight title.<ref>{{Citation|last=Premier Boxing Champions|title=Errol Spence Jr. vs Chris van Heerden: FULL FIGHT, September 11th, 2015 - PBC on Spike|date=2015-09-13|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4kaahbUTnB8|accessdate=2017-10-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.premierboxingchampions.com/news/errol-spence-jr-mugs-mugging-chris-van-heerden-smashing-tko-win|title=Errol Spence Jr. mugs a mugging Chris van Heerden in smashing TKO win|work=PBC Boxing|access-date=2017-10-07|language=en-US}}</ref>
In October 2015 it was announced that Spence would fight at [[The Bomb Factory]] in Dallas on November 28 against Mexican boxer [[Alejandro Barrera]] (28-2, 18 KOs).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-alejandro-barrera-on-november-28-pbc--97522|title=Errol Spence-Alejandro Barrera on November 28, PBC - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-10-07}}</ref><ref>{{Citation|last=Premier Boxing Champions|title=Spence Jr. vs Barrera FULL FIGHT: Nov. 28, 2015 - PBC on NBC|date=2015-12-09|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eWvF9cuiqlY|accessdate=2017-10-07}}</ref> Spence defeated Barrera via 5th-round TKO. This was an IBF eliminator for the number 2 spot in their welterweight contender rankings. Spence was ahead on all three judges scorecards (40-36, 3 times).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.badlefthook.com/2015/11/25/9799632/errol-spence-vs-alejandro-barrera-upgraded-to-title-eliminator|title=Spence-Barrera upgraded to world title eliminator|work=Bad Left Hook|access-date=2017-10-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingnews24.com/2015/11/errol-spence-jr-destroys-alejandro-barrera/|title=Errol Spence Jr. destroys Alejandro Barrera » Boxing News|date=2015-11-28|work=Boxing News 24|access-date=2017-10-07|language=en-US}}</ref>
Spence was named 2015 ESPN.com prospect of the year.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/14461974/errol-spence-jr|title=Prospect of the year: Errol Spence Jr.|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref>
==== Spence vs. Algieri ==== On 10 March 2016, it was announced that Spence would fight former [[light welterweight]] titlist [[Chris Algieri]] at the [[Barclays Center]] in [[Brooklyn]] on 16 April, his biggest fight to date. The fight was scheduled for 10 rounds.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/14943874/errol-spence-jr-faces-toughest-test-date-chris-algieri|title=Spence looking to make statement against Algieri|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref> In front of a pro-Algieri 7,628 crowd, Spence became the first boxer to stop Algieri. This was Spence's seventh straight knockout. The end came when Spence delivered a left hook to Algieri’s face. The hard shot sent Algieri straight to the canvas and referee Benjy Esteves waived the count. After the bout, Spence said "[[Kell Brook]] knows what time it is. We got to get in the ring and fight.". IBF later stated that Spence must have a final eliminator before he is declared mandatory challenger. .<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/boxing/news/12040/10246771/errol-spene-jr-stopped-chris-algieri-in-five-rounds|title=Errol Spence Jr stopped Chris Algieri in five rounds|work=Sky Sports|access-date=2017-05-28|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.premierboxingchampions.com/spence-vs-algieri|title=Spence vs Algieri Results & Highlights {{!}} April 16, 2016|work=PBC Boxing|access-date=2017-05-28|language=en-US}}</ref> For the fight, Spence earned $225,000 whilst Algieri earned $325,000. CompuBox punch statistics showed that Spence landed 96 of 311 punches (31%), whereas Algieri landed 36 of 114 thrown (32%).<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/15219645/errol-spence-jr-knocks-chris-algieri-fifth-round-premier-boxing-champions-main-event|title=Spence Jr. dominates Algieri in 5th-round TKO|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref> The fight averaged 1.482 million viewers on [[NBC]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/spence-algieri-pbc-card-draws-ratings-average-124-million--103578|title=Spence-Algieri PBC Card Draws Ratings Average of 1.24 Million - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref>
==== Spence vs. Bundu ==== On 16 May 2016, Spence denied that his team turned down a fight against Brook, which had been previously insinuated by [[Eddie Hearn]], Brook's promoter. Spence said that the IBF had ordered him to fight their #3 contender [[Konstantin Ponomarev (boxer)|Konstantin Ponomarev]] in order to become the mandatory challenger to Brook.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxingnews24.com/2016/05/errol-spence-denies-turning-kell-brook-fight/|title=Errol Spence denies turning down Kell Brook fight|date=2016-05-16|website=Boxing News 24|language=en-US|access-date=2016-05-16}}</ref> Although there were no agreements to fight, on June 9, Ponomarev injured his hand, forcing him out of the eliminator.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/16054321/konstantin-ponomarev-hurt-fight-eliminator-vs-errol-spence-jr|title=Ponomarev hurt, won't fight eliminator vs. Spence|website=ESPN.com|access-date=2016-06-10}}</ref> Instead, it was confirmed that Spence Jr. would fight IBF #7 [[Leonard Bundu]] (33-1-2, 12 KOs) in the eliminator on August 21 at the [[Ford Amphitheater at Coney Island|Ford Amphitheater]]. The fight would be aired on a Sunday night edition of ''[[Premier Boxing Champions]]'' on [[NBC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://thelivingdaylights.co/2016/06/30/errol-spence-jr-closing-in-on-deserved-title-shot/|title=Errol Spence Jr. closing in on deserved title shot|date=2016-06-30|website=The Living Daylights|access-date=2016-07-02}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.boxingnews24.com/2016/06/errol-spence-jr-vs-leonard-bundu-ibf-147lb-eliminator/|title=Errol Spence Jr. vs. Leonard Bundu in IBF 147lb eliminator|date=2016-06-08|website=Boxing News 24|language=en-US|access-date=2016-06-10}}</ref>
Spence focused on breaking down Bundu from the start. After five one-sided rounds, Spence backed Bundu against the ropes and connected with an uppercut that dropped Bundu. Referee Johnny Callas waved off the fight without starting a count. After the fight, Spence Jr. reiterated his desire of becoming IBF World champion stating, "I definitely want my shot at Kell Brook and his title, I want him next. If he vacates or gets stripped, then I'll fight for his vacant title. I've paid my dues." For the fight, Spence received $250,000 compared to Bundu's $30,000 purse.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/boxing/news/12183/10547358/errol-spence-jr-becomes-kell-brooks-mandatory-challenger-after-stopping-leonard-bundu|title=Errol Spence Jr becomes Kell Brook's mandatory challenger after stopping Leonard Bundu|last=|first=|date=August 22, 2016|website=Sky Sports|publisher=|access-date=September 28, 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/17361984/errol-spence-knocks-leonard-bundu-6th-round-pbc-card|title=Spence scores sixth-round knockout of Bundu|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-10-07}}</ref> The fight drew 4.8 million viewers on NBC and peaked at 6.34 million. This was the highest TV audience for boxing in over 10 years in the United States.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/blog/dan-rafael/post/_/id/16571/enormous-audience-for-spence-bundu-good-for-boxing|title=Enormous audience for Spence-Bundu good for boxing|website=Espn.com|access-date=2016-09-28}}</ref>
=== IBF welterweight champion ===
==== Spence vs. Brook ==== In January 2017, IBF welterweight champion [[Kell Brook]] and his team were in talks with [[Amir Khan (boxer)|Amir Khan]] over a potential fight, whilst also keeping the mandatory fight with Spence as second choice. During negotiations, Khan urged Brook to fight Spence first and eventually talks broke down between Brook and Khan. Brook's promoter [[Eddie Hearn]] mentioned talks were already ongoing with Spence's manager [[Al Haymon]] for a fight to take place possibly in the UK in May. Hearn received an extension from the IBF for negotiations between himself and TGB Promotions boss Tom Brown, as they were progressing.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/kell-brook-vs-errol-spence-targeted-uk--112576|title=Kell Brook vs. Errol Spence is Targeted For May in The UK - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-02-07}}</ref> The [[purse bid]]s for the fight was set for 7 February by the [[International Boxing Federation|IBF]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.ringtv.com/483013-kell-brook-likely-face-errol-spence-purse-bid-looming/|title=Kell Brook likely to face Errol Spence with purse bid looming - The Ring|date=2017-01-31|newspaper=The Ring|access-date=2017-02-07|language=en-US}}</ref> On February 1, Hearn claimed that Brook will be keeping his title and make the defense against Spence and that he had reached out to Spence's team, to no reply. He assumed that they wanted the fight to go to purse bids. Spence said that he had no problem travelling to the UK for the fight, regardless of negotiations.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/brook-promoter-we-made-offers-errol-spence-no-response--113206|title=Brook's Promoter: We Made Offers To Errol Spence - No Response! - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-expects-brook-shot-no-problem-fighting-uk--113247|title=Errol Spence Expects Brook Shot, "No Problem" Fighting in The UK - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-02-07}}</ref> With a deal close to being reached a day before the purse bids, the IBF granted a week extension, pushing the purse bid back 7 days.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/kell-brook-vs-errol-spence-deal-very-close-says-hearn--113364|title=Kell Brook vs. Errol Spence Deal is Very Close, Says Hearn - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-02-07}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/18632298/purse-bid-kell-brook-errol-spence-jr-fight-delayed|title=Purse bid for Brook-Spence fight delayed a week|newspaper=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-02-07}}</ref> On February 13, a deal was reached for the fight to take place in Sheffield on 20 May 2017.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/boxing/38963415|title=Kell Brook to defend welterweight title against Errol Spence Jr|date=2017-02-13|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2017-02-13/kell-brook-to-take-on-unbeaten-american-errol-spence/|title=Kell Brook to take on unbeaten American Errol Spence|work=ITV News|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/18679528/welterweight-titleholder-kell-brook-challenger-errol-spence-jr-meet-20-england|title=Brook to face Spence Jr. in England|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref> At a press conference at [[Bramall Lane]], [[Sheffield]] on March 22, the fight was officially announced to take place on May 27, 2017 live on [[Sky Box Office]] in the UK and [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] in the US.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/boxing/news/12183/10808937/brook-vs-spence-jr-kell-brook-to-defend-ibf-title-against-errol-spence-jr-at-bramall-lane-on-may-27|title=Brook vs Spence Jr: Kell Brook to defend IBF title against Errol Spence Jr at Bramall Lane on May 27|last=|first=|date=March 22, 2017|website=Sky Sports|access-date=March 23, 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/18975234/deal-finalized-kell-brook-errol-spence-jr-fight-set-27|title=Brook-Spence fight is official, set for May 27|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-03-23}}</ref>
In front of 27,000 fans, Spence dropped and eventually stopped Brook to win the IBF welterweight title after 11 rounds. In a fight where mostly power shots were landed, Spence threw combinations to the head and to the body, gradually wearing down Brook. Brook did well working the counter, and landed his own shots to the body. In round 10, Spence cornered Brook against the ropes and unloaded some heavy power shots, which caused Brook to take a knee. In round 11, Brook motioned many times that he couldn't see through his left eye and voluntarily took a knee. The referee started the 10 count, which Brook was unable to beat, giving him back to back defeats and his first as a welterweight. At the time of stoppage, all three judges had Spence ahead on their scorecards (97-92, 96-93, 95-94).<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/boxing/40071749|title=Kell Brook loses IBF world welterweight title to Errol Spence Jr|date=2017-05-27|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2017-05-28|language=en-GB}}</ref> Although he won the fight, Spence admitted it was not his best performance, "I give myself a B-. I was a little bit off with my offence and defence, but I give Kell a lot of credit. This is what true champions do. You go anywhere to fight." Spence landed 246 of 633 punches thrown (39%) while Brook landed 136 of 442 (31%).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-drops-stops-kell-brook-eleven-win-results--117009|title=Errol Spence Drops, Stops Kell Brook in Eleven To Win IBF Belt - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/19477017/kell-brook-loses-ibf-welterweight-title-errol-spence-11th-round-tko-sheffield-bramall-lane|title=Brook loses world title to Spence in Sheffield|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/19480639/next-welterweight-titlist-errol-spence-jr|title=What's next for welterweight titlist Errol Spence Jr.?|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-05-28}}</ref> The fight was shown in the afternoon in the US on Showtime and averaged 291,000 viewers, peaking at 337,000 viewers. These was considered low numbers, even for an afternoon showing, possibly due to it being a holiday weekend.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/spence-brook-peaked-337k-viewers-averaged-291k-on-showtime--117175|title=Spence-Brook Peaked at 337K Viewers; Averaged 291K on Showtime - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-06-05}}</ref> For the fight, Spence earned around £1 million and Brook earned a guaranteed £3 million.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.fightsaga.com/news/item/6800-kell-brook-purses-net-worth-ahead-of-spence-fight|title=Kell Brook purses, net worth ahead of Spence fight|last=Herron|first=Joseph|access-date=2018-01-01|language=en-gb}}</ref>
==== Spence vs. Peterson ==== On 3 October 2017, [[Lamont Peterson]] (35-3-1, 17 KOs) vacated his [[WBA (Regular)]] title in hopes of challenging Spence for the latter's IBF title.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingnews24.com/2017/10/lamont-peterson-vacates-wba-belt-face-spence-decjan/|title=Lamont Peterson vacates WBA belt, could face Spence in Dec/Jan » Boxing News|date=2017-10-03|work=Boxing News 24|access-date=2017-10-13|language=en-US}}</ref> Dan Rafael revealed that Spence was promised a $3.5 million purse from his manager Al Haymon for his next fight.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingnews24.com/2017/10/spences-purse-3-5m-next-fight/|title=Spence’s purse $3.5M for next fight » Boxing News|date=2017-10-12|work=Boxing News 24|access-date=2017-10-13|language=en-US}}</ref> On October 13, it was reported that terms would be finalised within a week. The fight was tentatively scheduled for Spence's 28th birthday, 13 January 2018 against Peterson. The event would be aired on Showtime. Peterson last saw action when he dethroned [[David Avanesyan]] in February 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/spence-vs-peterson-january-13--121362|title=Spence-Peterson Expected to Be Announced on Saturday for 1/13 - Boxing News|website=www.boxingscene.com|language=en-us|access-date=2017-10-13}}</ref> The fight was confirmed on 14 October, with Barclays Center the front-runner to land the fight. At a presser, Spence spoke fondly of Peterson, "He's somebody I looked up to in the amateurs and I learned a lot from. I had a training camp with him at the Olympic training center. So he's a guy I really look up to. He's one of my favorite fighters. He'll fight anybody. I've never known him to say no to a fight. I'm looking forward to it. He's got true grit. He's a real fighter. He's a guy who gives it his all and has a big heart."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/21025193/errol-spence-jr-make-first-defense-former-titlist-lamont-peterson|title=Spence to make first defense against Peterson|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2017-10-15}}</ref> On November 5, it was reported the fight was confirmed to take place at the [[Barclays Center]] in [[Brooklyn|Brookyn]] on January 20, 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.badlefthook.com/2017/11/5/16608844/spence-vs-peterson-fight-set-for-january-20-barclays-center+&cd=2&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=uk|title=Spence-Peterson set for January 20, Barclays Center|work=Bad Left Hook|access-date=2017-11-06}}</ref>
On fight night, in front of 12,107, Spence broke Peterson down mentally and physically eventually forcing Peterson's trainer Barry Hunter to stop the fight a second into round 8. Peterson was dropped in round 5 from a left hand by Spence. Peterson beat the count and looked unsteady, surviving the round. Peterson took a lot of punishment, but managed to fire back some offence of his own before the round ended. Peterson’s face looked swollen and his eyes were puffy from Spence’s hard shots. Spence also worked the body from the opening bell. After round 6, Peterson knew he was behind on the scorecards and indicated to his trainer, who said he would give him a few more rounds.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/boxing/news/12183/11216632/errol-spence-jr-defeats-lamont-peterson-to-successfully-defend-ibf-welterweight-title|title=Errol Spence Jr defeats Lamont Peterson to successfully defend IBF welterweight title|work=Sky Sports|access-date=2018-01-21|language=en}}</ref> In the post-fight interviews, Spence said, "I want to thank Lamont. A lot guys turned down the fight, and he took like a real warrior, and I commend him for that. My coach [Derrick James] came with a great game plan, and I just followed through with it. Keep my range, keep my composure." Spence admitted he would need to work on his defence a little. When interviewer [[Jim Gray (sportscaster)|Jim Gray]] asked Hunter about the stoppage, he replied, "It was really hard [to stop the fight], but if you know Lamont, you know he was not going to give up. So I had to stop it. At the end of the day this is my son right here. And there's nothing more valuable than his well being. If it comes to him or winning, I pick him. I care about him." After the fight, Spence called out unified champion [[Keith Thurman]], referring him to 'sometime'. At the time of stoppage, all three judges had their scorecards at 70-62 for Spence.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-drops-beats-down-lamont-peterson-results--124483|title=Errol Spence Drops, Beats Down Lamont Peterson For TKO Win|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-01-21|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/spence-i-want-some-time-thurman-he-keeps-making-excuses--124496|title=Spence: I Want 'Some Time' Thurman - He Keeps Making Excuses!|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-01-21|language=en-us}}</ref>
According to CompuBox stats, Spence landed 161 of 526 punches thrown (30%), and Peterson landed only 45 of his 158 thrown (28%). For the fight, Spence had an official purse of $1.2 million and Peterson's purse was $600,000.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/22164747/errol-spence-jr-defeats-lamont-peterson-eighth-round-tko-barclays-center|title=Spence batters Peterson in 8th-round TKO win|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-01-21}}</ref> The fight averaged 637,000 viewers and peaked at 695,000 viewers on Showtime.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/spence-peterson-peaked-695k-viewers-averaged-637k-on-sho--124567|title=Spence-Peterson Peaked at 695K Viewers, Averaged 637K on SHO|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-01-24|language=en-us}}</ref>
==== Spence vs. Ocampo ==== On January 23, 2018 the IBF sent a letter to TGB Promotions ordering Spence to make a mandatory defence against unbeaten prospect [[Carlos Ocampo]] (22-0, 13 KOs) next. Zanfer Promotions, who promote Ocampo were also notified and were given until February 22 to reach a deal before purse bids take place. Because Ocampo was not rated in the top 2 in the IBF rankings at the time, at purse bids, he would be entitled to 15% rather than the 25% that a mandatory challenger receives.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/22188987/errol-spence-ordered-make-title-defense-carlos-ocampo|title=Spence ordered to make defense vs. Ocampo|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-01-24}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-vs-carlos-ocampo-ordered-by-ibf--124564|title=Errol Spence vs. Carlos Ocampo Ordered By The IBF|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-01-24|language=en-us}}</ref> On January 24, Showtime announced that Spence would next fight on June 16 in Dallas, Texas.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-carlos-ocampo-next-june-16--124612|title=Errol Spence: Carlos Ocampo Could Be Next For June 16|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-01-25|language=en-us}}</ref> On February 24, according to ESPN, the IBF ordered purse bids to take place on March 6.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.badlefthook.com/2018/2/24/17048220/errol-spence-jr-ordered-to-purse-bid-for-mandatory-defense|title=Errol Spence Jr ordered to purse bid for mandatory defense|work=Bad Left Hook|access-date=2018-02-24}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/espn/now?nowId=1-22558407|title=The representatives for welterweight world titlist...|date=2018-02-24|website=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-02-24}}</ref> Four days later, it was revealed that both sides had reached a deal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-vs-carlos-ocampo-deal-reached-june-16--125723|title=Errol Spence vs. Carlos Ocampo Deal Reached For June 16|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-02-28|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/22599858/errol-spence-jr-defend-welterweight-title-hometown-dallas-carlos-ocampo|title=Spence to defend belt against Ocampo in June|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-02-28}}</ref> On April 30, an official press release confirmed the bout would take place at [[the Ford Center at The Star]] in Frisco.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-vs-carlos-ocampo-finalized-june-16--127700|title=Errol Spence vs. Carlos Ocampo Finalized For June 16|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-04-30|language=en-us}}</ref> In front of a sellout crowd of 12,604, Spence knocked Ocampo out in round 1 to retain his IBF title. In response to some body shots from Ocampo, Spence hit back with a hard left to the body that sent Ocampo to the canvas. Referee Lawrence Cole made the 10 count as Ocampo tried to get up, but was in too much pain. The time of the stoppage was at 3:00 of round 1. The knockout for Spence was his 11th consecutive stoppage since 2014. Spence stated he wanted to unify the division by going after the winner of the Shawn Porter vs. Danny Garcia, Keith Thurman and Terence Crawford. After the bout, Spence said, "I was a little disappointed. I wanted to give the crowd their money's worth. I wanted him to sustain a bit and give him some punishment, but the body shot got him and I dropped him." Spence wanted to go at least 5 rounds. According to Ocampo, it was overconfidence that caught up to him and ended his world title challenge. For the fight, Spence made $1.2 million and Ocampo was given a $75,000 purse. Numerous Cowboys players were in attendance, including quarterback Dak Prescott.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/errol-spence-wipes-out-carlos-ocampo-one-round-results--129189|title=Errol Spence Wipes Out Carlos Ocampo in One Round|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.com/boxing/story/_/id/23816623/errol-spence-jr-makes-quick-work-carlos-ocampo-first-round-ko|title=Spence KO's overmatched Ocampo in 1st round|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-07-02}}</ref> The fight averaged 683,000 viewers and peaked at 726,000 viewers on Showtime, an increase from his previous bout.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/showtimes-spence-ocampo-main-event-peaked-726k-viewers--129268|title=Showtime's Spence-Ocampo Main Event Peaked at 726K Viewers|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-07-02|language=en-us}}</ref>
==== Spence vs. Garcia ==== On October 25, 2018 BoxingScene.com reported that negotiations between Spence and [[Mikey Garcia]] (39-0, 30 KOs) were progessing, with the fight likely to take place in Febryary 2019 on Showtime PPV.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/garcia-commey-not-next-garcia-spence-negotiations-progressing--133128|title=Garcia-Commey Not Next; Garcia-Spence Negotiations Progressing|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-10-30|language=en-us}}</ref> Garcia first began to call out Spence for a fight before he defeated and unified the lightweight division in July. On October 30, Garcia vacated his IBF lightweight title and the purse bid for the potential [[Richard Commey]] fight was cancelled.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/mikey-garcia-gives-up-ibf-ibf-order-commey-chaniev--133265|title=Mikey Garcia Gives Up IBF; IBF To Order Commey-Chaniev|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-10-30|language=en-us}}</ref> On November 13, PBC made an official announcement for their 2019 schedule. It was announced the fight between Garcia and Spence would take place at the welterweight limit at the [[AT&T Stadium]] in [[Arlington, Texas]] on March 16, 2019 exclusively on [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX PPV]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingscene.com/spence-garcia-announced-fox-ppv-march-16--133684|title=Spence-Garcia To Be Announced As FOX PPV March 16|work=BoxingScene.com|access-date=2018-11-14|language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.espn.co.uk/boxing/story/_/id/25269962/errol-spence-jr-vs-mikey-garcia-announced-march-16-dallas|title=Spence-Garcia bout to headline March 16 card|work=ESPN.com|access-date=2018-11-14|language=en}}</ref>Many fans reacted to fight being announced. Some welcoming the fight and praising Garcia for 'daring to be great' and some fans believed the size difference would be too much as Spence is considered a big welterweight.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.boxingnewsandviews.com/2018/11/14/boxing-world-reacts-to-errol-spence-vs-mikey-garcia-super-fight/|title=Boxing World Reacts To Errol Spence vs Mikey Garcia Super Fight|date=2018-11-14|work=Boxing News and Views|access-date=2018-11-14|language=en-US}}</ref>

'''Florence Wyndham''' (1538-1596), wife of Sir John Wyndham (died 1572) of [[Orchard Wyndham]] in Somerset, was a daughter of [[John Wadham (died 1578)]] of [[Merryfield, Ilton]] in Somerset and [[Edge, Branscombe]] in Devon and was a sister and co-heiress of [[Nicholas Wadham]] (1531/2 – 1609), co-founder of [[Wadham College, Oxford]]. ==Buried alive== Her fame rests on a remarkable escape from a horrific death and her singular importance to the survival of the Wyndham family. In 1556 she married Sir John Wyndham of [[Orchard Wyndham]] and a year later was taken ill and thought to have died. She was buried in the Wyndham family vault in St [[Decuman]]’s church at [[Watchet]], Somerset and that same night a covetous sexton opened her coffin in order to remove her rings and cut one of her fingers in the process. She had in fact fallen into some sort of [[catalepsy|cataleptic trance]], and was now awakened by the pain and rose from her coffin. The sexton fled leaving his lantern behind him; and with its aid she made her way home across the fields to her astounded family. Soon afterwards she gave birth to her only son, Sir [[John Wyndham (1558-1645)|John Wyndham]] (1558–1645), from whom every member of the Wyndham family is descended (apart from a branch of the family in the United States whose progenitor is Vice Admiral Sir Thomas Wyndham, [[Henry VIII]]'s distinguished naval commander). Her remarkable survival and importance as a valuable heiress is celebrated in the family by successive generations naming the eldest son [[Wadham Wyndham (disambiguation)|Wadham Wyndham]], most especially by the Salisbury branch of [[St Edmund's College, Salisbury|St Edmund's College]] founded by Sir [[Wadham Wyndham (judge)|Wadham Wyndham]]. ===Source of story=== The source of the story is unclear, but it appears to have become much embellished over time. Delderfield (1968) calls the sexton a [[verger]], by the name of Attewell.Delderfield, Eric, ''West Country Historic Houses and their Families'', Newton Abbot, 1968, pp.86-8: ''Kentisford Farm'', p.88 One of the earliest renditions is by the Somerset historian [[John Collinson (died 1793)|Collinson]] (d.1793), published in 1791, who was more charitable to the sexton/verger than later narrators and states relatively simply:[[John Collinson (historian)|Collinson, John]], ''History and Antiquities of the County of Somerset'', Volume 3, London, 1791, p.490: ''Orchard''[https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=qoIgAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA486&lpg=PA486&dq=collinson+st+decuman&source=bl&ots=dDOuq8mp3z&sig=ppdTdyD_ehEjyYLpXDNpD2Hm2lE&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjdrsf_4bjJAhUBSBoKHfX6AWYQ6AEIOzAE#v=onepage&q=collinson%20st%20decuman&f=false] :"It is said that this lady was the year after her marriage, 1562, (''sic, her son was born in 1558'') buried, having in a sickness lost all appearance of life; but the sexton hearing some noise in the coffin, as he was closing the vault in the church of St. Decuman's, she was happily taken up, and soon after delivered of Sir John Wyndham". ==Lady Wyndham's Return== (See full text on wikisource [[s:Lady Wyndham's Return]] A poem about her remarkable escape, called 'Lady Wyndham's Return', was written by Rev. Lewis H. Court, Vicar of St Decuman's church, and includes the following verses: He seized the slender fingers white
And stiff in their repose
Then sought to file the circlet through;
When to his horror blood he drew,
And the fair sleeper rose She sat a moment gazed around,
Then great was her surprise,
And sexton startled saw at a glance
This was not death but a deep trance,
And madness leapt to his eyes. The stagnant life steam in her veins
Again began to flow
She felt the sudden quickening,
For her it was a joyous thing,
For him a fearsome woe. ==References== {{Reflist}} * Wyndham, the Hon H A, "A Family History, The Wyndhams of Somerset, Sussex and Wilstshire", 1950. ==External links== *[http://holmesacourt.org/d8/i0000473.htm#i471b Holmes à Court Family Website.] *[http://myweb.tiscali.co.uk/stdecumanswatchet/Watchet/Three_Holy_Sites/three_holy_sites.html St Decuman's Church, Wyndham Memorials] *[http://www.quantockonline.co.uk/quantocks/villages/watchet/watchet.html Quantock Online, Watchet.] *[https://soundcloud.com/music-for-zombies/florence-wyndham The Story of Florence Wyndham - Spoken Word by Chris Lambert and MFZ] {{DEFAULTSORT:Wadham, Florence}} [[Category:1596 deaths]] [[Category:16th-century births]] [[Category:Wyndham family|Florence]] [[Category:16th-century English women]] [[Category:16th-century English people]] [[Category:Women of the Tudor period]] [[Category:Wadham family]] [[Category:Burials in Somerset]] [[Category:Premature burials]]

[[Regent's Canal]], [[London Borough of Hackney|Hackney]], London | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | monuments = | residence = London | nationality = [[British people|British]] | other_names = | education = | alma_mater = | occupation = Actress | years_active = 1997–2001 | agent = | known_for = | notable_works = ''[[EastEnders]]'' | home_town = | height = 4 ft 11 in{{cite news|last=Rickman|first=Dina|title=Gemma McCluskie Missing: Police Divers Search Canal For Body Parts|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/03/08/gemma-mccluskie-missing-police-divers-additional-searches-body_n_1331012.html|accessdate=9 March 2012|newspaper=The Huffington Post UK|date=8 March 2012}} | weight = | television = | religion = | denomination = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = Tony McCluskie, Anthony McCluskie, Danny McCluskie | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | signature_size = }} '''Gemma Rose Veronica McCluskie''' (5 February 1983 – 1 March 2012) was a British television actress. Her most notable role was in the [[BBC]] [[soap opera]] ''[[EastEnders]]'', in which she played the semi-regular character [[Kerry Skinner]]. In March 2012, McCluskie disappeared from her home in [[East (London sub region)|East London]]; a few days later, her dismembered body was discovered in the [[Regent's Canal]]. Her brother, Tony McCluskie, was found guilty of her murder.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/2012/mar/10/gemma-mccluskie-eastender-actor-murder-brother-charged|title=Gemma McCluskie's brother charged with her murder|last=Jones|first=Cass|date=2012-03-10|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-06-30|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}} ==Career== McCluskie's best-known role was [[Kerry Skinner]] in the BBC soap opera ''[[EastEnders]]'', her character appeared between October 2000 and February 2001. In the show, McCluskie's character was a close friend of [[Zoe Slater]] ([[Michelle Ryan]]) and the great-niece of the recently killed off [[Ethel Skinner]] ([[Gretchen Franklin]]), and also the girlfriend of long-serving character [[Robbie Jackson]] ([[Dean Gaffney]]).{{cite news|title=Arrest after torso feared to be EastEnders actress found|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-17290560|work=BBC News|publisher=BBC|date=7 March 2012|accessdate=7 March 2012}} She also appeared in the TV series ''[[No Sweat (TV series)|No Sweat]]''.{{cite news|url=https://www.pressreader.com/uk/the-scotsman/20121208/283716951684539|work=The Scotsman|title=I killed her, says brother of Eastenders actress found dead in canal|date=8 December 2012}} ==Disappearance and death== McCluskie went missing from her East London flat, where she lived with her brother Tony,[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-21014793 Gemma McCluskie 'killed after sink row'] on 1 March 2012. She was seen at home with her brother that afternoon, and a subsequent investigation found that she had entered a [[kebab shop]] around 8 pm. A search party of 100 people was organised by McCluskie's cousins on 5 March, which spread out from the [[East End of London|east]] and [[South London|south]] of London, attempting to discover information related to McCluskie's disappearance.{{cite news|last=Nelson|first=Sara C|title=Gemma McCluskie Missing: Body Pulled From Regents Canal In Hunt For Former EastEnders Star|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/03/07/gemma-mccluskie-missing-body-pulled-from-regents-canal-in-hunt-for-former-eastenders-star_n_1326068.html|accessdate=9 March 2012|newspaper=The Huffington Post UK|date=7 March 2012}} The headless [[torso]] of a woman was recovered from [[Regent's Canal]] in [[London Borough of Hackney|Hackney]] on 6 March. On 9 March, the police announced that the body had been formally identified as McCluskie.{{cite news|title=Canal body is ex-Eastenders actress MuCluskie|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-17319303|work=BBC News|publisher=BBC|date=9 March 2012|accessdate=9 March 2012}} On 10 March, a 35-year-old male (later identified as her brother, Tony McCluskie) was charged with her murder.{{cite news|url=http://news.sky.com/story/2376/eastenders-actress-murder-brother-charged |title=EastEnders Actress Murder: Brother Charged |publisher=British Sky Broadcasting |work=Sky News |date=11 March 2012 |accessdate=10 September 2012}} He appeared at Thames [[Magistrates' Court (England and Wales)|Magistrates' Court]] on Monday, 12 March[http://www.metro.co.uk/news/892848-brother-of-gemma-mccluskie-appears-in-court-charged-with-her-murder Brother of Gemma McCluskie Appears in Court Charged With Her Murder] Metro, 12 March 2012[https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-17328033 Brother of Ex-EastEnders McCluskie charged with her murder] BBC News, 10 March 2012. Retrieved 10 March 2012. and a preliminary hearing was set for 26 March at the [[Old Bailey]].{{cite news|first=John|last=Hall |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/brother-appears-in-court-over-gemma-mccluskie-murder-7562334.html |title=Brother appears in court over Gemma McCluskie murder |publisher=Independent Print Ltd |newspaper=The Independent |date=12 March 2012 |accessdate=13 March 2012}} On 10 September, police found a head in the same stretch of canal.{{cite news|first=John|last=Hall|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/severed-head-recovered-from-regents-canal-where-decapitated-remains-of-former-eastenders-actress-gemma-mccluskie-were-found-8120976.html|title=Severed head recovered from Regent's Canal where decapitated remains of former EastEnders actress Gemma McCluskie were found|publisher=Independent Print Ltd|newspaper=The Independent|date=10 September 2012|accessdate=12 September 2012}} The Metropolitan Police confirmed the head was McCluskie's two days later.{{cite news|first=Margaret|last=Davis|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/police-confirm-severed-head-found-in-hackney-canal-belongs-to-exeastenders-actress-gemma-mccluskie-8130737.html|title=Police confirm severed head found in Hackney canal belongs to ex-Eastenders actress Gemma McCluskie|publisher=Independent Print Ltd|newspaper=The Independent|date=12 September 2012|accessdate=12 September 2012}} On 28 September, Tony McCluskie accepted responsibility for the death of his sister. Gemma McCluskie's funeral was held on 30 November at St Monica's Roman Catholic Church, Hoxton Square, East London.{{cite news|url=http://www.eastlondonadvertiser.co.uk/news/gemma-mccluskie-death-mourners-gather-for-actress-s-funeral-1-1716738|work=East London Advertiser|title=Gemma McCluskie death: Mourners gather for actress's funeral|date=30 November 2012}} ==Trial and sentence of brother== The trial began on 14 January 2013 at the Old Bailey. During the trial, it was reported that Tony McCluskie was a heavy cannabis user and that the siblings frequently argued. On 1 March 2012, he allegedly argued with his sister about an overflowing bath. She told him to leave, and he then grabbed her by the wrists and punched her to the floor, but claimed he had no further recollection of his actions. Her death was caused by several blows to the head with a blunt instrument. He spent several hours dismembering her body. [[CCTV]] footage showed Tony carrying a suitcase the next day; the suitcase contained her remains, which Tony disposed of in Regent's Canal. McCluskie initially admitted manslaughter, but denied murder, citing a "loss of control". He was found guilty of her murder on 30 January 2013 and jailed for life with a minimum sentence of 20 years.{{cite news|title=EastEnders' Gemma McCluskie death: Brother faces murder trial|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-20640533|work=BBC News|publisher=BBC|date=28 September 2012|accessdate=28 September 2012}} ==Filmography== ;Television {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |- ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Title ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Role ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Notes |- | 1997 || ''[[No Sweat (TV series)|No Sweat]]'' || Janis || 18 episodes |- | 2000–01 || ''[[EastEnders]]'' || [[Kerry Skinner]] || 34 episodes |} == See also == *[[List of people who disappeared mysteriously]] == References == {{Reflist|2}} == External links == *{{IMDb name|id=0566070|name=Gemma McCluskie}} {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:McCluskie, Gemma}} [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:2010s missing person cases]] [[Category:2012 deaths]] [[Category:Actresses from London]] [[Category:British people of Irish descent]] [[Category:British soap opera actresses]] [[Category:Deaths by beating]] [[Category:English murder victims]] [[Category:Female murder victims]] [[Category:Formerly missing people found dead]] [[Category:Missing person cases in England]] [[Category:Murdered actresses]] [[Category:Murder in 2012]] [[Category:People murdered in London]] [[Category:Sororicides]]

'''''Heaven and Hell''''' is the common English title of a book written by [[Emanuel Swedenborg]] in [[Latin]], published in 1758. The full title is '''''Heaven and its Wonders and Hell From Things Heard and Seen''''', or, in Latin: '''''De Caelo et Eius Mirabilibus et de inferno, ex Auditis et Visis.''''' It gives a detailed description of the [[afterlife]], how people live after the death of the [[physical body]]. The book owes its appeal to that subject matter.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/ES/epic30.htm|title=The Swedenborg Epic: Chapter 30|website=www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref>
==Introduction== An article about Swedenborg<ref>[http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/es.html "Who Was Emanuel Swedenborg (1688–1772)?"], accessed May 2012.</ref> includes a list of biographies about him, with a brief analysis of each biographer's point of view. Some of the things he claims to have experienced are that there are [[Jews]], [[Muslims]] and people of pre-Christian times ("[[Paganism|pagans]]" such as [[ancient Rome|Romans]] and [[ancient Greece|Greeks]]) in Heaven. He says he spoke to married angel couples from the Golden Age who had been happy in heaven for thousands of years.<ref>[http://smallcanonsearch.com/read.php?book=ml&section=75 ''Marriage Love'' #7] at smallcanonsearch.com</ref> The fundamental issue of life, he says, is that love of self or of the world drives one towards Hell, and love of God and of fellow beings drives one towards Heaven.
The work proved to be influential. It has been translated into a number of languages, including [[Danish language|Danish]], French, English, [[Hindi]], [[Russian language|Russian]], [[Spanish language|Spanish]], [[Icelandic language|Icelandic]], [[Swedish language|Swedish]] and [[Zulu language|Zulu]]. A variety of important cultural figures, both writers and artists, were influenced by Swedenborg, including [[Johnny Appleseed]], [[William Blake]], [[Jorge Luis Borges]], [[Daniel Burnham]], [[Arthur Conan Doyle]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.classic-literature.co.uk/scottish-authors/arthur-conan-doyle/the-history-of-spiritualism-vol-i/ebook-page-02.asp|title=Arthur Conan Doyle - The History of Spiritualism Vol I Page 02|website=www.classic-literature.co.uk|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> [[Ralph Waldo Emerson]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Ondb2uKhq_YC&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=Representative men: seven lectures|first=Ralph Waldo|last=Emerson|date=30 October 2018|publisher=B. Tauchnitz|accessdate=30 October 2018|via=Google Books}}</ref> [[John Flaxman]], [[George Inness]], [[Henry James, Sr.]], [[Carl Jung]],<ref>{{cite news| title=Carl Gustav Jung News - The New York Times|url=http://topics.nytimes.com/top/reference/timestopics/people/j/carl_gustav_jung/index.html | work=The New York Times | first=Sara | last=Corbett}}</ref> [[Immanuel Kant]], [[Honoré de Balzac]], [[Helen Keller]], [[Czesław Miłosz]], [[August Strindberg]], [[D. T. Suzuki]], and [[W. B. Yeats]]. [[Edgar Allan Poe]] mentions this book in his work ''[[The Fall of the House of Usher]]''.<ref>Perry, B. Little Masterpieces. Poe, E.A. The Fall of the House of Usher, Garden City, MY, Doubleday 1921</ref> It also plays an important role in [[Honoré de Balzac]]'s novel ''[[Louis Lambert (novel)|Louis Lambert]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gutenberg.org/etext/1943 |title=Louis Lambert at Project Gutenberg| accessdate=2009-07-19}}</ref> [[William Blake]] referred to and criticized ''Heaven and Hell'' and Swedenborg by name several times in his poetical/theological essay ''[[The Marriage of Heaven and Hell]]''.
Swedenborg wrote about Heaven and Hell based on what he said was revelation from [[God]].<ref>Swedenborg, E [http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/HH.html ''Heaven and its Wonders and Hell. From Things Heard and Seen''] (Swedenborg Foundation, 1946).</ref> According to Swedenborg, God is love itself<ref>Swedenborg, ''Heaven and Hell'' 545ff.)</ref> and intends everyone to go to heaven. That was His purpose for creation.<ref>Swedenborg, E [http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/dptc.html ''Angelic Wisdom concerning The Divine Providence''] (Swedenborg Foundation, 1954, #234:6,7)</ref> Thus, God is never angry, Swedenborg says, and does not cast anyone into Hell. The appearance of Him being angry at evil-doers was permitted due to the primitive level of understanding of people in Biblical times. Specifically, holy fear was needed to keep the people of those times from sinking irretrievably into the consequences of their evils. The holy fear idea was in keeping with the fundamental truth that even they could understand, that everything comes from Jehovah.<ref>Swedenborg, E [http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/AC.htm ''Arcana Coelestia. The heavenly arcana contained in the Holy Scripture or Word of the Lord unfolded, beginning with the book of Genesis together with wonderful things seen in the World of Spirits and in the heaven of angels.''] Swedenborg Foundation, 1956 #6997:2, 7632)</ref> In the internal, spiritual sense of the Word, however, revealed in Swedenborg’s works, God can be clearly seen for the loving Person He actually is.<ref>''Heaven and Hell,'' #546ff.</ref>
==Some basic teachings==
===God is One=== ''Heaven and Hell'' opens with an affirmation<ref>Swedenborg, E.[http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/HH.html ''Heaven and Hell''] Swedenborg Foundation 1946, #2</ref> of the many statements in the Old and New Testaments (e.g. Deuteronomy 6:4, Isaiah 44:6, 45: 14, 21, Mark 12: 29,32, John 1:18, Revelation 11:17) and Swedenborg’s revelation (e.g.,<ref>Swedenborg E. [http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/tcrtc.html ''The True Christian Religion''] Swedenborg Foundation, 1946 # 5-7</ref><ref>Swedenborg E. [http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/dlwtc.html ''The Divine Love and Wisdom''] Swedenborg Foundation 1946, # 23)</ref>) that there is a God and He is one. If God is all-powerful, He must be one. It is self-contradictory to say that there is more than one being who is all-powerful.<ref>Kingslake, p. 20</ref>
===Angels=== Swedenborg details a life after death that consists of real experiences in a world in many basic ways quite similar to the natural world. According to Swedenborg, [[Angel|angels]] in heaven do not have an ethereal or ephemeral existence but enjoy an active life of service to others. They sleep and wake, love, breathe, eat, talk, read, work, play, and worship. They live a genuine life in a real spiritual body and world.<ref>Synnestvedt, S. ''The Essential Swedenborg'', Swedenborg Foundation 1977, p. 104</ref>
According to Swedenborg, we in the natural world can only see angels here when our spiritual eyes are opened. This corresponds to many instances in the Old Testament <ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ccel.org/contrib/exec_outlines/angel/angel_02.htm|title=Ministering Spirits - Angels In The Old Testament|website=www.ccel.org|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> and New Testament (Matthew 18, Luke 2:14, Matthew 17, Luke 24, Revelation 1:10). Swedenborg received his revelation by the same process of his spiritual eyes being opened by God.<ref>''True Christian Religion,'' #779</ref><ref>”From things heard and seen,” part of ''Heaven and Hell' book title.</ref>
An angel’s whole environment – clothes, houses, towns, plants, etc. – are what Swedenborg terms [[correspondence (theology)|correspondences]]. In other words, their environment spiritually reflects, and thus "corresponds" to, the mental state of the angel and changes as the angel's state changes.<ref>''Heaven and Hell'' #179, 183</ref>
Swedenborg writes that angels have no power of their own. God's power works through the Angel's to restrain evil spirits, one angel being able to restrain a thousand such spirits all at once. Angels exercise God's power chiefly in defending people against hell. Swedenborg is explicitly clear that Angels have no power whatsoever of their own, they neither take nor like to receive thanks or accept any credit.<ref>E. Swedenborg: [http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/AC.htm ''The Arcana Coelestia''], Swedenborg Foundation 1946, #6344</ref>
In the Christian world it is believed that in the beginning angels and [[Devil|devils]] were created in heaven, also that the devil or Satan was an angel of light, but having rebelled he was cast down with his crew, and thus hell was formed. Swedenborg states that, on the contrary, every angel or devil began life as an inhabitant of the human race.<ref>''Heaven and Hell'' #311</ref> In other words, there are no angels or demons who were not people on Earth first.<ref>Benz , E. ''Emanuel Swedenborg. Visionary Savant in the Age of Reason'', Swedenborg Foundation, 2002, p. 403; Originally published as ''Emanuel Swedenborg. Naturforscher und Sehr'', Zurich; Swedenborg Verlag 1948</ref><ref>''Heaven and Hell'' #311-317, 544</ref>
Children who die go directly to heaven, where they are raised by angel mothers.<ref>See Chapter on "Children in Heaven" in ''Heaven and Hell'' #332ff.</ref><ref>Kingslake, p. 49</ref>
===Men and women=== Angels are men and women in every detail just as they were here on earth, only they are spiritual and thus more perfect. See Chapter on “Marriage in Heaven” in ''Heaven and Hell''<ref>[http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/HH.html ''Marriage Love''] Swedenborg Foundation 1946, Chapter 40, # 366ff.</ref> and Swedenborg’s book on the topic, ''Marriage Love'' (''Conjugial Love'' in older translations).<ref>E. Swedenborg [http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/MLtc.html ''Marriage (“Conjugial”) Love''] Swedenborg Society 1953, # 27ff.</ref> The spiritual conjunction of husband and wife that is the basis of true marriage in this world and the next is explained in ''Heaven and Hell'' # 366ff. and ''Marriage Love'' #156ff. {{quotation|The states of [true marriage love] are innocence, peace, tranquility, intimate friendship, full trust and a desire shared by the disposition and heart of each to do the other all the good they can. All these things give rise to blessedness, bliss, joy and pleasure, and by their everlasting heavenly happiness.|''Marriage Love'' #180}} Swedenborg says that this true married love was known in antiquity but largely lost since then, mainly due to loss in belief that this love is eternal and that there is life after death.<ref>''Marriage Love''# 58</ref>
===The Christian marriage ideal=== According to Swedenborg, married life continues after death as before, agreeing with the instinctive conviction of poets and lovers whose inward assurances tell them their love will surmount death and that they will live again and love again in human form.<ref name="swedenborgdigitallibrary.org">{{cite web|url=http://www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/ES/epic38.htm|title=The Swedenborg Epic: Chapter 38|website=www.swedenborgdigitallibrary.org|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> In other words, there is no “till death do us part” of happily married couples. (See “The Lord God Jesus Christ on marriage in heaven”<ref>{{cite web|url=http://swedenborgproject.org/2011/08/22/the-lord-god-jesus-christ-on-marriage-in-heaven/|title=The Lord God Jesus Christ on Marriage In Heaven|date=22 August 2011|publisher=|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref>)
Swedenborg also says that Christian marriage love of one man and one woman is the highest of all loves, the source of the greatest bliss.<ref>Trobridge, p. 193</ref> “For in themselves Christian marriages are so holy that there is nothing more holy. They are the seminaries of the human race, and the human race is the seminary of the heavens.” <ref>''Arcana Coelestia''# 9961</ref><ref name="swedenborgdigitallibrary.org"/>
The spiritual conjunction of husband and wife that is the basis of Christian marriage in this world and the next, is explained in ''Heaven and Hell'' # 366ff. and ''Marriage Love'' (''Conjugial Love'' in older translations) #156ff. Evidence of this conjunction is found in the fact that husband and wife together are called [one] “man” or “one flesh” in Genesis 1:27, 2:22-24, 5:2, and Mark 10:8.
In heavenly marriages neither partner tries to dominate the other since love of dominion of one partner eliminates the delight of that marriage.<ref>''Heaven and Hell'' #369, 380</ref>
The ancients believed in a fountain of perpetual youth. In heaven their dream is realized, for those who leave this world old, decrepit, diseased in body or deformed, renew their youth, and maintain their lives in the full vigor of early manhood and womanhood.<ref>Trobridge, p. 194</ref>
Swedenborg says that couples who lived in a chaste love of Christian marriage are more than all others in the order and form of heaven, and therefore in all beauty, and continue unceasingly in the flower of youth. The delights of their love are ineffable, and increase to eternity. What their outward delights are it is impossible to describe in human words.<ref>''Heaven and Hell'' # 489</ref>
=== Polygamy=== “[[Polygamy]]” is used here to describe any marital relationship between men and women other than one [[husband]] with one [[wife]].<ref>''Marriage Love'' #332ff.</ref> A further variant is “Multiple Partners, but One at a Time” <ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/roomfordebate/2012/01/20/the-gingrich-question-cheating-vs-open-marriage/americans-prefer-serial-monogamy-to-open-relationships | work=The New York Times | title=The Gingrich Question: Cheating vs. Open Marriage | date=May 21, 2013}}</ref> (i.e. serial monogamy). If done for evil reasons, such as lust, it constitutes “successive polygamy.” <ref>''Marriage Love'' #317ff.</ref>
Swedenborg said in his revelation that true Christian marriage love between one husband and several wives is impossible for its spiritual origin, which is the formation of one mind out of two, is thus destroyed.<ref>''Marriage Love,'' # 379</ref> He says that love that is divided among a number of Christian partners is not true marriage love, but lasciviousness.<ref>''Arcana Coelestia'' # 1907.</ref> According to Swedenborg, a Christian who marries more than one wife commits not only natural adultery but also spiritual adultery.<ref name="auto">''Marriage Love,'' #339ff.</ref> In the highest sense to commit adultery means to deny the divinity of Jesus Christ and to profane the Word. Adultery is so great an evil, Swedenborg says, "that it may be called diabolism itself".<ref>Swedenborg, E. ''Doctrine of Life'' (Swedenborg Foundation 1946, #74)</ref> After death the damnation of Christian polygamists is more severe than the damnation of those who committed only natural adultery.<ref name="auto"/> In the other life adulterers love filth and live in filthy hells <ref>''Arcana Coelestia,'' # 5394, 5722</ref><ref>Synnestvedt, p. 74ff.</ref><ref>Sigstedt, p. 356ff.</ref>
===Time and space in the spiritual world=== There is neither time nor space as we understand them in the other world. Both are replaced by a sense of state. See Chapter 18, “Time in Heaven” and Chapter 22, “Space in Heaven,” in Swedenborg E. ''Heaven and Hell,'' Swedenborg Foundation 1946, # 70, 191<ref>{{cite web|url=http://swedenborgdigitallibrary.org/contets/HH.html|title=Heaven and its Wonders and Hell From Things Heard and Seen by Emanuel Swedenborg|website=swedenborgdigitallibrary.org|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref>
===World of Spirits=== The "World of Spirits" is not to be confused with “the spiritual world,” which is a general term referring to the whole extent of Heaven, Hell and the World of Spirits. The traditional Christian idea was of resurrection on Judgment Day at the end of history. Swedenborg says judgment takes place in the World of Spirits immediately after each individual’s death.<ref>Benz, p. 390</ref> After we die, we wake up in the intermediate region of the spiritual world, neither in Heaven nor Hell, but in a neutral "no man's land" that Swedenborg terms the "World of Spirits." <ref>See Chapter on “World of Spirits” in ''Heaven and Hell.'' Swedenborg Foundation, 1946, pp. 421ff.</ref> Here we gradually lose the ability to pretend and the spiritual “real us” comes out.<ref>Kingslake, B. ''Inner Light. Swedenborg Explores the Spiritual Dimension,'' J. Appleseed & Co., 2001, p. 44</ref> The resulting stripping of one's self bare, even to one's most secret thoughts and intentions, is the judgment.<ref>Kingslake, B. ''Inner Light. Swedenborg Explores the Spiritual Dimension", J. Appleseed & Co., 2001, p. 44</ref> “There is nothing concealed that shall not be uncovered, and nothing secret that shall not be known …” (Luke 12:2, 3; Matthew 10:26, ''Heaven and Hell,'' #498). Following this judgment the new spirit goes on to Heaven or Hell of his or her own free will. God does not force them. Spirits gather with those that are alike to themselves, whether in Heaven or Hell. Each Spirit is granted Angels and good Spirits, though evil spirits cannot endure their presence and so depart.<ref>''Heaven and Hell,'' #545</ref>
===Equilibrium and spiritual free will=== According to Swedenborg, people are kept in spiritual freedom by means of the equilibrium between Heaven and Hell.<ref>See Chapter on “The Equilibrium Between Heaven and Hell” in ''Heaven and Hell'', #589ff.</ref><ref>''Arcna Coelestia'', #597</ref>
So who sends people to Heaven or Hell? Nobody but themselves. There is no inquiry as to their faith or former church affiliations, or whether they were baptized, or even what kind of life they lived on Earth. They migrate toward a heavenly or hellish state because they are drawn to its way of life, and for no other reason.<ref>Kingslake, B. ''Inner Light. Swedenborg Explores the Spiritual Dimension'', J. Appleseed, 2001, p. 6</ref>
Anyone can enter heaven. However, as soon as an evil person inhales the air there they have excruciating torment so they quickly shun it and escape to a state/place in keeping with their true state.<ref>Spalding, JH. ''Introduction to Swedenborg’s Religious Thought'', Swedenborg Publishing Association 1966, p. 27</ref> As the old saying goes, “Where the tree falls, there it lies.”<ref>Ecclesiastes 11:3, ''Divine Providence'', #277</ref> The basic spiritual orientation of a person toward good or evil cannot be changed after death. Thus, an evil spirit could leave hell, but never wants to.<ref>''Heaven and Hell'', #480</ref>
== Influence on Joseph Smith and Mormon theology ==
[[D. Michael Quinn]] suggests in his book ''[[D. Michael Quinn#Early Mormonism and the Magic World View|Early Mormonism and the Magic World View]]'' that ''Heaven and Hell'' influenced [[Joseph Smith]] in the creation of the [[Latter Day Saint]] view of the afterlife detailed in Doctrine and Covenants Section 76.
However, many of the similarities are rooted in Biblical language and by interpreting Biblical texts{{Citation needed|date=August 2013}}. For example, the general view of three Heavens in the resurrection appears{{According to whom|date=August 2013}} to have its root from the writings attributed to the apostle Paul found in the New Testament, 1 Cor 15:40–42:
:"There are also celestial bodies, and bodies terrestrial: but the glory of the celestial is one, and the glory of the terrestrial is another. There is one glory of the sun, and another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars: for one star differeth from another star in glory. So also is the resurrection of the dead."
Allegorically, Swedenborg likens both the nature of each heaven as well as the illumination in the sky of each heaven to the sun, moon, and stars.<ref>Heaven and Hell, #119</ref> He states that the sun of the celestial heaven and the moon of the spiritual kingdom is the Lord.<ref>Heaven and Hell, #118</ref> In [[Mormonism]]'s view of I Cor 15:40–42, the resurrected bodies of those in three [[degrees of glory]] (celestial, terrestrial, and telestial heavens) are likened to the Sun, Moon, and stars.
Others who acknowledge parallels, including Mormon historian [[Richard Bushman]], propose that the similarities between the revelations of Smith and Swedenborg are due to the influence of Paul's writing on both of them.<ref>[[Richard Bushman|Bushman, Richard]]: ''[[Joseph Smith: Rough Stone Rolling]]'', 2005, p. 199.</ref>
It should be noted, however, that Corinthians is not included in the list of books that, according to Swedenborg, constitute the divinely inspired Biblical canon listed in ''Arcana Coelestia'' 10,325,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://smallcanonsearch.com/read.php?book=ac&section=10325|title=AC 10325 - Small Canon Search - Reading - The Word of God, The Whole Word of God, and Nothing But the Word of God - Searching the Small Canon of Scripture|website=smallcanonsearch.com|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> ''White Horse'' 16,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://smallcanonsearch.com/read.php?book=wh&section=16|title=WH 16 - Small Canon Search - Reading - The Word of God, The Whole Word of God, and Nothing But the Word of God - Searching the Small Canon of Scripture|website=smallcanonsearch.com|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> and ''New Jerusalem and its Heavenly Doctrine'' 266.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://smallcanonsearch.com/read.php?book=njhd&section=266|title=NJHD 266 - Small Canon Search - Reading - The Word of God, The Whole Word of God, and Nothing But the Word of God - Searching the Small Canon of Scripture|website=smallcanonsearch.com|accessdate=30 October 2018}}</ref> From Swedenborg’s perspective the teachings of Corinthians are thus not authoritative and he would not have been influenced by them.<ref>Sigstedt, C. ''The Swedenborg Epic'' (Bookman Associates 1952, p. 324)</ref><ref>Kingslake, B.[ Lawrence, J., ed.] ''Inner Light. Swedenborg Explores the Spiritual Dimension'' (J. Appleseed & Co., p. 112)</ref>

'''Henry Ralph Mahler''' (1921–1983) was an [[Austria]]n-born American biochemist known for his research in the field of [[neurochemistry]]. ==Biography== Mahler was born in 1921 in [[Vienna]], Austria. He emigrated to [[the United States]] in 1938, where he enrolled in [[Swarthmore College]], from which he graduating in 1943. The same year, he enrolled at the [[University of California, Berkeley]], where he received his Ph.D. in 1948. At Berkeley, he conducted research on [[chloroplast]]s under the direction of [[Melvin Calvin]].<ref name=cotman>{{Cite journal |last=Cotman |first=Carl W. |date=April 1984 |title=In Memoriam: Henry R. Mahler 1921-1983 |url=https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/abs/10.1111/j.1471-4159.1984.tb12733.x |journal=Journal of Neurochemistry |language=en |volume=42 |issue=4 |pages=1200–1202 |doi=10.1111/j.1471-4159.1984.tb12733.x |issn=0022-3042}}</ref> He then completed his [[postdoc]] at the [[Texas Research Foundation]] before joining the faculty of the [[University of Wisconsin, Madison]]'s Enzyme Institute in 1949 as a research assistant. In 1951, he became an assistant professor there.<ref name=memorial>{{Cite web |url=http://webapp1.dlib.indiana.edu/bfc/view?docId=B10-1984&chunk.id=d1e97&toc.id=&brand=bfc |title=Memorial Resolution Research Professor Henry R. Mahler |date=1983-11-01 |website=Indiana University Bloomington Faculty Council Circular |access-date=2018-09-02}}</ref>
In 1955, he moved to [[Bloomington, Indiana|Bloomington]], [[Indiana]] to join the faculty of [[Indiana University]] as an associate professor. He was promoted to full professor at Indiana University in 1957, and was named Research Professor of Chemistry and Neural Sciences there in 1966. In the 1976-77 academic year, he served as an honor fellow at [[University College London]], a Visiting Professor at [[Gif-sur-Yvette]], [[France]], and a Visiting Professor at the Institut fur Allgemeine Biochemie of the [[University of Vienna]].<ref name=memorial/> In 1972, he collaborated with his Indiana University colleague [[Rudolf Raff]] on a paper criticizing the theory that [[mitochondria]] in the cells of higher organisms originated as independent, [[single-celled organism]]s.<ref>{{Cite magazine |last=Information |first=Reed Business |date=1972-08-31 |title=Monitor |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=tMUKmNZwPrsC |magazine=New Scientist |language=en |publisher=Reed Business Information |page=421 |access-date=2018-09-02}}</ref>
He died on July 6, 1983 of [[heart failure]] at [[Woods Hole, Massachusetts|Woods Hole]], [[Massachusetts]].<ref name=cotman/> ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=58229952|LCCN=n89666146}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mahler, Henry Ralph}} {{Biochemist-stub}}

{{hatnote|In this [[Japanese name]], the first surname is ''Hayakawa'' and also use [[Spanish naming customs]] in the second or maternal family name is ''Salas''.}} {{More citations needed|date=September 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Hiromi Hayakawa | image = Hiromi Hayakawa 2017.png | alt = | caption = Hayakawa in 2017 | birth_name = Marla Hiromi Hayakawa Salas | birth_date = {{Birth date|1982|10|19}} | birth_place = [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]], [[Japan]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|2017|9|27|1982|10|19}} | death_place = [[Mexico City]], [[Mexico]] | death_cause =Liver hemorrhage | residence = | nationality = [[Mexicans|Mexican]] | other_names = | occupation = [[Actor|Actress]], [[singing|singer]] | years_active = 2000–2017 | known_for = | notable_works = | home_town = [[Torreón]], [[Mexico]] | television = [[La Academia]] | spouse = {{marriage|Fernando Santana|2017}} | children = 1 (stillborn) | module = {{Infobox musical artist|embed=yes | background = solo_singer | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]], [[Latin American music|Latin]] | instrument = Vocals | label = [[Independent music|Independent]] }} }} '''Marla Hiromi Hayakawa Salas''' (October 19, 1982 – September 27, 2017), known professionally as '''Hiromi Hayakawa''', was a [[Japanese Mexicans|Japanese-born Mexican]] actress and singer who began her music career as a contestant in the reality show ''[[La Academia]]''.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.elsiglodetorreon.com.mx/noticia/92504.hiromi-se-va-de-la-academia.html|title=Hiromi se va de La Academia|date=7 June 2004|work=[[El Siglo de Torreón]]|language=Spanish|accessdate=16 May 2010}}</ref> She worked mostly in [[musical theatre]], however she has had occasional television roles. Hayakawa was also a [[voice acting|voice actress]], who worked primarily on the [[Hispanic America|Spanish American]] dub of films and series from the United States.
==Early life== Hayakawa was born in [[Fukuoka]] to Alfonso Javier Hayakawa, who is of [[Japanese Mexicans|Japanese]] descent and a native of [[Torreón]], [[Coahuila]] and Lourdes Elsa Salas, from the city of [[Chihuahua, Chihuahua|Chihuahua]], making her of Mexican and Japanese descent. Her parents resided in Fukuoka while her father studied Industrial Engineering there. They returned to Mexico when Hiromi was only two years old and at the time, her mother was pregnant with her second child, Kaori.
==Career== ===''La Academia''=== When she attended a casting call for ''[[La Academia]]'', Hayakawa scored 9.7 points out of a possible ten points. Though, before competing in ''La Academia'', Hayakawa studied Industrial Engineering and Systems at the [[Monterrey Institute of Technology and Higher Education]] in Coahuila. She decided to attend the casting for ''La Academia'' because, as with most people who attend the castings, she saw it as a chance of pursuing a musical career.
Hayakawa left ''La Academia'' after the thirteenth concert; though she was later re-cast and became the sixth runner-up as the winner. The last song she sang as an official contestant was "La Playa" by La Oreja de Van Gogh. Two weeks after her expulsion, Hayakawa was given the opportunity to return to La Academia and become a finalist. Hayakawa and two other ex-students (Ricardo Hernández Quiñones and Dulce Lopez Rodriguez) were given a song which they had to perform in the next concert. The public would then vote on who they wanted to return to the finale instead of voting on who was going to be expelled. In the end Dulce Lopez Rodriguez won and went to the finale where she won 2nd place. One of the judges, Lolita Cortez, was very disappointed in the results.
===Theater=== Hayakawa is best known for her work on ''Mentiras: The Musical'', based on the pop culture and music of the 1980s. She has played all of the main roles: [[Daniela Romo|Daniela]], Dulce, [[Lupita D'Alessio|Lupita]], [[Yuri (Mexican singer)|Yuri]], [[Emmanuel (singer)|Emmanuel]] and [[Manoella Torres|Manoella]].
She is also known for her role as [[Mulan]] in ''12 Princesas en Pugna'', a satirical take on the [[Disney Princesses]]. Hayakawa has also worked on the Mexican adaptations of ''[[Peter Pan]]'' and ''[[Hairspray (musical)|Hairspray]]''.
===Voice acting=== In 2012, she voiced [[Merida (Disney)|Merida]], the protagonist of Pixar's ''[[Brave (2012 film)|Brave]]'', for the [[Hispanic America|Spanish American]] dub. She also was Sonata Dusk from Hasbro's [[Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks]], Draculaura from [[Monster High]], Bunny Blanc and Ginger Breadhouse from [[Ever After High]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Dice Hiromi que fue un reto hacer la voz de "Mérida" en "Valiente"|url=http://es-us.omg.yahoo.com/noticias/hiromi-reto-voz-m%C3%A9rida-valiente-193800107.html|publisher=Yahoo! News en Español|accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref>
==Death== Hayakawa was expecting a baby, due on October 21, 2017. On September 26, she was rushed to a hospital and was discovered to have bleeding in the [[liver]]. Efforts were made to save the child, named Julieta, but she died at around 11 pm. Hayakawa died before noon, the following day. She was 34.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.univision.com/entretenimiento/muere-la-cantante-y-actriz-mexicana-hiromi-hayakawa-y-tambien-su-bebe-julieta |title=Muere Hiromi Hayakawa de 'La Academia' por complicaciones en el embarazo: también falleció la bebé |date=September 27, 2017 |publisher=[[Univision]] |access-date=September 28, 2017}}</ref> On September 28, Hayakawa and Julieta were cremated, and the ashes will remain in Mexico City with her husband.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/espectaculos/farandula/familia-teatral-da-el-ultimo-adios-hiromi|title=Familia teatral da el último adiós a Hiromi|date=2017-09-28|work=El Universal|access-date=2017-09-28|language=es}}</ref>
